name: Titan Graph DB 1.0.0 backend DynamoDB, Gremlin-Groovy, Loopback, NodeJs
body:
### Welcome.
I decided to add up some notes & share my latest experience with the technology stack of:
* Titan Graph DB 1.0.0 with DynamoDB as backend
* Gremlin-Groovy using Gremlin Server
* Wrapped by an API Layer made of Loopback under NodeJs 
Which I used to execute social features over REST API (i guess it will be) focused mainly on titan graph DB. 

### Downloads & References
The setup is easy and consisting of a few steps:
1. install dynamo db locally
2. install titan 1.0.0 with dynamo as backend
3. for API i used loopback over nodeJs which provided easy to setup API framework

### Versions, Downloads ... References
[Running DynamoDB Locally](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/Tools.DynamoDBLocal.html)
Mostly what this docs say is download unpack and run the java server (need Java 1.7(#TODO: maybe 1.8 need to check) and above)

[The Amazon DynamoDB Storage Backend for Titan 1.0.0](https://github.com/awslabs/dynamodb-titan-storage-backend)
Again, mostly what this docs say is download unpack and run the java server (need Java 1.7(#TODO: maybe 1.8 need to check) and above)

[Yet Another how to install by AWS](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/Tools.TitanDB.DownloadingAndRunning.html)

[From Local to Production - Some Settings you might need](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/Tools.TitanDB.Storage.DDBLocal.html)

[Titan Graph DB Referece](http://tinkerpop.apache.org/docs/3.1.1-incubating/reference/)

### Setup

Installing DynamoDB Localy
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/Tools.DynamoDBLocal.html

Running DynamoDB Localy
mvn test -Pstart-dynamodb-local

Running gremlin server
bin/gremlin-server.sh ${PWD}/conf/gremlin-server/gremlin-server-local.yaml

Running gremlin console
bin/gremlin.sh
  
### Final Notes 
YAY!! At this point you should have a running gremlin console!!   
ready to shot commands to your titan server.
[Follow this link to the Wiki] (https://github.com/adico-twistit/adico-twistit.github.io/wiki) where i'll constantly add more and more pages regarding different issues I faced with the mentioned technology stack.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
